segment_text: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: “For a hundred thousand eons
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: and four incalculable ages,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: all my conduct in that period
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: ripens in awakening.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: Setting aside my conduct
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: in past eons through different lives,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I shall speak of my conduct
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: in this eon, hear me.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: When I lived having plunged
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: into the formidable jungle
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: of empty thickets and glades,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: my name was Akitti the mortifier.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: Then, burned by the fires of my mortification,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: the sovereign of the heaven of the Thirty-three,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: came to me for alms
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: in the form of a brahmin.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I had gathered leaves from the forest
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: without oil or salt,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: and seeing him standing at my door,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I placed them in his pot.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: After giving him the leaves
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I turned over my plate,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: and having given up on seeking more food,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I entered my hut of leaves.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: A second and a third time
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: he came to me.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: Undisturbed, ungrasping,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I gave in just the same way.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: That is the reason why
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: my body is not discolored.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: In rapture and bliss free of relishing
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I spend the day.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: If even for a month or two
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I were to find a worthy recipient,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: undisturbed, unattached,
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I would give the supreme gift.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: While giving him that gift
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I did not wish for fame or profit.
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: Wishing for omniscience
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: I performed those deeds.”
title: Akitti’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: a brahmin called Saṅkha,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: wanting to cross the great ocean,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: I was on my way to the port.
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: There I saw across the way
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: one self-awakened, undefeated,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: walking a desert road
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: whose ground was hot and rough.
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: Seeing him across the way,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: I thought this:
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘A field has appeared
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: for a person desiring merit.
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: Now suppose a farmer
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: seeing a fertile field
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: does not sow seed there,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: then they are not in need of grain.
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: So too, if I, desiring merit,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: seeing a supreme excellent field,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: do not render service there,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: then I am not in need of merit.
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: Or suppose a minister seeking the royal seal
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: of authority over the people of the court,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: does not give them money and grain,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: their authority dwindles.
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: So too, if I, desiring merit,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: seeing an abundantly worthy recipient,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: do not give gifts to them,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: I will dwindle in merit.’
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: Reflecting in this way,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: I took off my sandals
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: and bowed to his feet,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: giving him an umbrella and sandals.
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: Though I was a hundred times
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: more delicate and dainty than him,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: fulfilling my generosity,
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: I gave like this to him.”
title: Saṅkha’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I reigned
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: as the king named Dhanañjaya
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: I was blessed with the ten skillful deeds.
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: From the realm of Kaliṅga
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: brahmins came to me
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: requesting the royal elephant
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: that was lucky and deemed auspicious.
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Our nation is suffering from drought,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: food is scarce and famine abounds,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: please give the noble elephant
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: of midnight hue named Añjana.’
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘When supplicants come to me
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: it is unbefitting to refuse.
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: Let not my vow be broken,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: I shall give the mighty elephant.’
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: Taking the elephant by the trunk,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: and a bejewelled ceremonial vessel,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: I sprinkled water on the hand,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: and gave the elephant to the brahmins.
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: When I had given the elephant,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: my ministers said,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Why did you give the noble elephant
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: to the supplicants?
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: He was lucky and endowed with the auspicious,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: supreme victor in battle.
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: Now you have given the elephant,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: how shall you govern the realm?’
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I would give the entire realm
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: and my physical body as well.
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: Omniscience is precious to me,
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: which is why I gave away the elephant.’”
title: Kururāja’s Conduct

segment_text: “When I was Lord of the Earth
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: when I was Lord of the Earth,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: my name was Sudassana the Great,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: a wheel-turning monarch of great power.
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Who needs what? Who wants what?
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: To whom ought riches be given?
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: Who needs an umbrella? Who is thirsty?
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: What person, being naked,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: and will put on colorful clothes?
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: Who will take an embrella on a highway,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: who needs sandals, soft and pretty?
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: Thus I had it proclaimed everywhere
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: morning and night.
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: It was not just in ten places,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: or even a hundred,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: but in many hundreds of places
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: riches were prepared for supplicants.
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: By day or by night
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: if a nomad comes,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: then having gotten all he wants,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: he leaves with full hands.
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: for my whole life.
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: I did not give because I disliked riches,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: or because I had a store set aside.
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: Suppose a person is sick.
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: In order to be free of sickness
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: having compensated the doctor with money,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: they become freed from sickness.
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: in order to fulfill without remainder,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: I gave gifts to nomads
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: without clinging or reward,
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: for the attainment of awakening.”
title: Mahāsudassana’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: high priest for seven kings,
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: I was venerated by men and gods
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: as the brahmin Mahāgovinda.
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: Then in all seven kingdoms
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: what I receieved as tribute
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: I used to give a great gift
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: unwavering as the ocean.
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: It was not because I disliked riches or grain,
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: or because I had a store set aside,
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: but because omniscience is precious to me,
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: that is why I gave such fine riches.”
title: Mahāgovinda’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: in the capital city of Mithilā
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: I was the great king named Nimi,
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: astute and seeking the good.
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: Then having had constructed
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: four halls with four openings,
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: I provided gifts there
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: for beasts, birds, men, and so forth.
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: Clothing and beds,
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: food and drink to enjoy:
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: I provided them without let,
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: performing a great offering.
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: Suppose a servant is looking
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: to get a raise from their boss,
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: they’d seek to fulfill their needs
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: by body, speech, and mind.
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: In that way in every life
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: I shall seek the wisdom born of awakening.
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: Having pleased beings with gifts,
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: I wish for the supreme awakening.”
title: King Nimi’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: the true-born son of the One King
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: in the city of flowers, Pupphavatī,
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: I was called Prince Canda, the Moon.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: Then, released from being sacrificed,
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: I fled the sacrificial enclosure.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: Giving rise to a sense of urgency,
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: I performed a great offering.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: I did not drink, I did not eat,
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: I did not enjoy any food
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: for five or six days
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: with having first offering to a worthy recipient.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: Suppose there was a merchant
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: who had made a store of goods.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: They would take those goods
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: to where they could make a large profit.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: So too, even giving what one has used oneself
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: to others is very fruitful.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: That is why what is to be given to others
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: multiplies a hundredfold.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: Knowing the reason for this,
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: I gave gifts in life after life.
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: I never relented in giving
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: for the attainment of awakening.”
title: Prince Candana’s Conduct

segment_text: “In the city called Ariṭṭha
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: I was the aristocrat named Sivi.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Seated in my finest longhouse,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: I then had the following thought:
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Whatever human gifts there are,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: none may be found that I have not given.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Even if someone were to ask for my eye,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: I would give it without wavering.’
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Knowing my thoughts,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Sakka the lord of Gods,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: sitting in the assembly of gods
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: said the following.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Seated in his finest longhouse,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: the mighty King Sivi
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: is thinking of manifold gifts
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: and cannot see any he would not give.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Is this is true or not?
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Come, let us test him.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Wait a minute
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: until I know his mind.’
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Appearing as a frail old man,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: with grey hair and wrinkled skin,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: feeble and blind,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: he approached the king.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Then, stretching out
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: his left and right arms,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: he raised his joined palms to his head
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: and said the following.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Great king, I have a request for you.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Under your just rule the kingdom has flourished,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: and the renown of your love of giving
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: has risen among gods and humans.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Both my eyes, by which I find my way,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: are ruined and become blind.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Give me just one eye,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: while you too get by with one.’
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: After hearing his words
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: I was thrilled, my mind elated,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: so with joined palms, inspired,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: I said the following.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Just now I was reflecting on this
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: when I came here from the longhouse.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Understanding my mind,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: you have come to ask for an eye.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Oh! My wish has come true!
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: My intention is fulfilled!
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Today I shall give to a supplicant
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: a fine gift never before given.’
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Come Sivaka, stand up,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: do not hesitate or waver.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Pluck out even both eyes
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: and give them to the beggar.’
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: And then, urged on by me,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Sivaka did as I said.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: Extracting both eyes,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: he presented them to the trembling supplicant.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘While planning to give, while giving,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: and after I had given,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: my mind did not falter,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: because it was solely for awakening.
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: It was not because I disliked my eyes,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: or that I disliked myself,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: but because omniscience is precious to me,
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: that is why I gave away my eyes.’”
title: King Sivi’s Conduct

segment_text: “She who was my mother,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: the aristocrat lady named Phussatī,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: was Sakka’s beloved queen
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: in past lives.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Knowing that she was at the end of life,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: the Lord of Gods said this:
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I grant you ten favors,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: my dear, whatever favor you wish.’
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: When he said this the queen
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: replied to Sakka:
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘In what way am I deficient?
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: How am I displeasing to you?
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: You send me from this lovely place,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: like the wind a feeble tree.’
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: When she said this Sakka
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: replied to her:
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘You have done nothing wrong,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: nor are you not beloved to me.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: But you life lasts only so long,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: your time of death will come.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Accept the ten supreme favors
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: I offer to you.’
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: She accepted the offerings of Sakka,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: full of joy and happiness.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Having conceived me,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Phussatī was blessed with the ten favors.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Then Phussatī, having passed from there,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: was reborn as an aristocrat
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: in the city of Jetuttara,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: where she married Sañjaya.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Once I was conceived in the womb
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: of my dear mother Phussatī,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: because of my power,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: my mother always delighted in giving.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: She gave to the destitute, the ailing and aging,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: to beggars, travelers, and folk,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: to ascetics and brahmins, and the dispossessed,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: and to those who had nothing.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Having carried me for ten months,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: she was proceeding around the city
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: when Phussatī gave birth to me
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: in the middle of the peasant’s street.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: My name was not from my mother’s side,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: nor from my father’s.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: I was born there in the peasant’s street,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: and that’s why I’m called Vessantara.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: When I was a boy
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: of only eight years old,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: sitting in the stilt longhouse,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: I thought of giving gifts.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I would give my heart and my eyes,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: my flesh and blood too.’
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: I announced that I would give my body,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: if anyone asked me.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Reflecting on my state of mind,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: so undisturbed and steadfast,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: the earth quaked there,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: and Mount Sineru, wreathed in forests.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Every fortnight, the fifteenth,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: and the sabbath when the moon was full,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: I mounted the tusker Paccaya
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: and went to give gifts.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: From the country of Kaliṅga,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: the brahmins came to me,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: requesting the royal elephant,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: that was lucky and deemed as auspicious.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Our nation is suffering from drought,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: food is scarce and famine abounds,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: please give the noble elephant
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: the all-white supreme elephant.’
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I give without hesitation
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: what you ask of me, brahmins.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: I do not hide what I have,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: for my heart is happy to give.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: When supplicants come to me
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: it is unbefitting to refuse.
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Let not my vow be broken,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: I shall give the mighty elephant.’
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

segment_text: Taking the elephant by the trunk,
title: Vessantara’s Conduct

title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: by wild frontier savages.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: Before going to put an end to it,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: my father instructed me:
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘My dear, do not neglect
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: the matted-hair ascetic of severe penance.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: He is the granter of our wishes,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: give him all he desires.’
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: I went then to serve him,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: and said the following.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I hope you are well, householder.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: Is there anything I can bring for you?’
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: At that he was upset with me,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: that prideful charlatan.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I’ll have you killed right now!
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: Or banished from the realm!’
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: After putting an end to the border conflict,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: the king said to the charlatan,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I hope you’re keeping well, sir,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: and honors were served you?’
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: That wicked one told him
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: how the prince deserved execution.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: When he heard these words,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: the Lord of the Earth commanded:
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Cut off his head right there!
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: Saw his corpse into four pieces!
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: And then show them from street to street:
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: this is the fate of one who shames the ascetic.’
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: Rightaway left the executioners—
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: fierce, violent and pitiless.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: They dragged me from my mother’s lap
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: and led me away.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: I said to them
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: as they bound me with tight bonds:
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Present me to the king right now,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: I have an issue for the king!’
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: They presented me to the king,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: follower of the wicked one and his wicked ways.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: On seeing me, I persuaded him
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: and brought him under my influence.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: He asked for my forgiveness then,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: and offered me the kingdom.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: But having burst the darkness asunder,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: I went forth to homelessness.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: I did not dislike great kingship,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: nor did I dislike sensual enjoyment.
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: But because omniscience is precious to me,
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: that is why I renounced kingship.”
title: Somanassa’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: the true-born son of the king of Kāsi,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I grew up in an iron house,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: so I was named Ayoghara.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Your life has been a painful one,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: as you’ve been raised in confinement.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: Today, my son, rule
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: the entirety of this land.’
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: Having bowed to the citizens of country and town,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: the king and his people,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I raised my joined palms
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: and said the following.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘All the creatures of this earth—
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: low, middle, or high—
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: are unprotected in their own home,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: in which they grew up with their families.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: It was unique in the world
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: to be raised in confinement.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I grew up in an iron house,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: scarcely lit by sun or moon.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: Filled with rotting carcass,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I escaped my mother’s womb.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: Then to a viler suffering
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I was tossed in an iron house.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: Having fallen into such
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: appallingly dreadful suffering,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: if I desired kingships,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I’d be the worst of the worst.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I’m fed up with the body,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I have no need for kingship.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I shall seek extinguishment
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: where Death will not crush me.’
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: Reflecting in this way,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: as the great crowd wailed,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: like a bull elephant bursting his ropes,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I entered the forest grove.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: I had no dislike of my parents,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: nor did I dislike the great fame.
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: But because omniscience is precious to me,
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: that is why I renounced kingship.”
title: Ayoghara’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: in the capital citadel of Kāsi,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: a sister and seven brothers
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: were born in a learned family.
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: I was the first-born of them all,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: furnishing with pure conscience.
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: Seeing rebirth as fearful,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: I longed for renunciation.
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: Sent for by my mother and father,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: my friends with one mind
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: invited me to enjoy sensual pleasures, saying:
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: ‘Maintain the family lineage.’
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: The words they said
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: about the ways a householder can find happiness,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: were hard for me to hear,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: like a heated ploughshare.
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: When I rejected their proposal,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: they asked me what I wished for:
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: ‘My dear, what is it that you wish,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: since you do not long for sensual pleasures?”
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: I spoke to my beneficiaries
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: of the goal I desired.
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: ‘I wish not for the householder’s state,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: I long for renunciation.’
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: Hearing my words,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: they told my mother and father .
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: My parents said this:
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: ‘Sirs, let all of us go forth!’
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: So both my mother and father,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: sister and seven brothers,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: discarding countless riches,
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: entered the great forest.”
title: The Conduct of the Lotus-eaters

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: in the city of Brahmavaḍḍhana,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: I was reborn there
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: in a fine, wealthy, and eminent family.
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: Even so, I saw that the world
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: had become blind, smothered in darkness.
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: My mind recoiled from rebirth,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: as if harshly pricked by a goad.
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: Seeing the many forms of wickedness,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: I though to myself:
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘When shall I leave the house
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: and enter the forest?’
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: Then too my relatives invited me
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: to enjoy the pleasures of the senses.
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: I told them of my desire, saying,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Do not invite me to such things!’
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: My younger brother,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: who was named Nanda the astute,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: followed my ethical practices,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: and chose to go forth.
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: I, Soṇa, and Nanda,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: and both my mother and father,
title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

title: Soṇa the Astute’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: the true-born son of the king of Kāsi,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Mūgapakkha was my name,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: they called me Temiya.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: None of the sixteen thousand court women
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: had given birth to a male.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: After many days and nights
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I was born, the only one.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: To my father I was a dear son born with difficulty,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: a light-bringer of impeccable lineage.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Holding a white umbrella over my bed,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: he brought me up.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Sleeping on the fine bed,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: then having awoken,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I saw the pale umbrella,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: by which I had gone to hell.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: At the sight of the umbrella
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: a terrible dread arose in me.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I reached the decision,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘How can I be free of this?’
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: A former blood-relation of mine,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: a goddess wishing to help,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: saw my suffering
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: and enjoined me to three states.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Don’t show intelligence,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: be as a fool to all creatures,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: let all folk scorn you,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: thus you will achieve your goal.’
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: When she had spoken,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I said the following.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I shall do your bidding,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: just as you say, goddess.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: You wish to help me, mom,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: you desire my welfare, goddess.’
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: After hearing her words,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I was like one lost a sea reaching the shore.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I was thrilled, my mind elated,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: and I resolved on three factors.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I became deaf, and dumb,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: and crippled, unable to walk.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Resolving on these factors,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I lived for sixteen years.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Then they rubbed my hands and feet,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: my tongue and ears as well,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: and seeing no defect in me,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: denounced me as ‘black-ear’.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Due to that, the entire country,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: including the generals and priests,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: with one mind
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: cheered as I was tossed aside.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: When I heard of their decision
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I was thrilled, my mind elated,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘The goal for which I lived fervently
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I have achieved.’
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Bathed and oiled,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: with my turban wrapped,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: anointed, they held the umbrella
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: as they paraded me around the city.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: After the seventh day holding the umbrella,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: when the sun’s orb had risen,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I was taken out by chariot,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: until the charioteer came to a wood.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Leaving the chariot in the open,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: the bridled horse released from his hand,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: the charioteer dug a pit
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: to bury me in the ground.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I was afraid for the many different
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: resolves that I had undertaken,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: so I did not break that resolve,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: because it was solely for awakening.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I had no dislike of my parents,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: nor did I dislike myself.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: But because omniscience is precious to me,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: that is why I resolved on my vow.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: Having resolved the three factors,
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: I lived for sixteen years.
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: There is no-one to equal my resolve:
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: this is my perfection of resolve.”
title: Temiya’s Conduct

segment_text: “When I was a monkey

segment_text: in a cleft on the riverbank,
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: harassed by a crocodile
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: I could not get across.
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: Where I used to land
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: when jumping from the near shore to the far,
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: there crouched my deadly foe,
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: the baleful crocodile.
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: Reassuring me, he said ‘Come!’
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I am coming,’ I said to him.
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: I spoke no lie to him,
title: The Monkey King’s Conduct

segment_text: but acted according to my word.

segment_text: an ascetic known as Truthful,
title: The Ascetic Truthful’s Conduct

title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: a baby quail in Magadha,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: just a morsel in the nest.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: for I had no physical strength.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: It came towards us,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: a conflagration with a blackened trail.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: The fire roared and rumbled
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: with great crests of flame,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: gradually burning
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: closer to me.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: Alarmed and terrified at the fierce fire,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: my mother and father
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: abandoned me in the nest,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: saving themselves.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: I beat my feet and wings,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: but I had no physical strength.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: When unable to leave,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: I thought this there:
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘Those to whom I ought to run,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: scared and trembling with fear,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: have escaped, leaving me behind.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: How should I act today?’
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: There is the quality of virtue in the world,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: truth, purity, and mercy.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: By this truth I will make
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: a supreme declaration of truth.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: Inspired by the power of Dhamma,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: recollecting the former Victors,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: relying on the power of truth,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: I made a declaration of truth.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘I have wings that do not fly!
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: I have feet that do not walk!
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: Mother and father have left!
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: Fire: go back!’
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: As I declared this truth
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: the great crested flames
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: withdrew sixteen leagues,
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: as if they had come to water.
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: There is no-one to equal my truthfulness:
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: this is my perfection of truth.”
title: The Baby Quail’s Conduct

segment_text: “Then again when I was
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: a fish king in a great lake,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: in the heat of the sun
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: the water in the lake evaporated.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: Then crows and vultures,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: herons, hawks, and falcons,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: perched near the fish
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: and devoured them day and night.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: There I had the following thought,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: being harassed with my relatives:
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘By what means
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: can I free my relatives from this suffering?’
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: Considering the value of the Dhamma,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: I saw the truth as a support.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: Satnding in the truth,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: I freed my relatives from that holocaust.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: Recollecting the true Dhamma,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: considered the ultimate goal,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: I made a declaration of truth
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: that would last eternally in the world.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: ‘So long as I can recall myself,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: since I became aware,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: I do not recall deliberately
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: harming even a single living creature.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

title: The Fish King’s Conduct

title: The Fish King’s Conduct

title: The Fish King’s Conduct

title: The Fish King’s Conduct

title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: and free the fish from sorrow!’
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: As this excellent truth was declared,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: Pajjuna thundered forth.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: soaking the uplands and valleys.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: Having made such supreme effort
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: for this excellent truth,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: I made the great cloud pour down,
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: relying on the force of the power of truth.
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: There is no-one to equal my truthfulness:
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

segment_text: this is my perfection of truth.”
title: The Fish King’s Conduct

title: Dark Light’s Conduct

title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: “Mendicants, don’t fear good deeds.
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: For ‘good deeds’ is a term for happiness, for what is likable, desirable, and agreeable.
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: I recall undergoing for a long time the likable, desirable, and agreeable results of good deeds performed over a long time.
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: As a result, for seven eons of the cosmos contracting and expanding I didn’t return to this world again.
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: As the eon contracted I went to the realm of streaming radiance.
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: As it expanded I was reborn in an empty mansion of Brahmā.
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: There I was Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the vanquisher, the unvanquished, the universal seer, the wielder of power.
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: I was Sakka, lord of gods, thirty-six times.
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: Many hundreds of times I was a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. My dominion extended to all four sides, I achieved stability in the country, and I possessed the seven treasures.

segment_text: Not to mention regional kingship!
title: The Benefits of Love

segment_text: Then I thought,
title: The Benefits of Love

title: The Benefits of Love

title: The Meditation on Love

segment_text: “Mendicants, of all the grounds for making worldly merit, none are worth a sixteenth part of the heart’s release by love.
title: The Meditation on Love

segment_text: Surpassing them, the heart’s release by love shines and glows and radiates.
title: The Meditation on Love

segment_text: It’s like how the radiance of all the stars is not worth a sixteenth part of the moon’s radiance. Surpassing them, the moon’s radiance shines and glows and radiates.
title: The Meditation on Love

segment_text: In the same way, of all the grounds for making worldly merit, none are worth a sixteenth part of the heart’s release by love. Surpassing them, the heart’s release by love shines and glows and radiates.
title: The Meditation on Love

segment_text: It’s like the time after the rainy season when the sky is clear and cloudless. And when the sun rises, it dispels all the darkness from the sky as it shines and glows and radiates.
title: The Meditation on Love

segment_text: In the same way, of all the grounds for making worldly merit, none are worth a sixteenth part of the heart’s release by love. Surpassing them, the heart’s release by love shines and glows and radiates.

segment_text: “These two bright things, mendicants, protect the world.

segment_text: What two?
title: Bright Things

segment_text: Conscience and prudence.
title: Bright Things

segment_text: If these two bright things did not protect the world, there would be no recognition of the status of mother, aunts, or wives and partners of teachers and respected people.
title: Bright Things

segment_text: The world would become dissolute, like goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, and dogs and jackals.

segment_text: But because the two bright things protect the world, there is recognition of the status of mother, aunts, and wives and partners of teachers and respected people.”

segment_text: “There is, mendicants, an unborn, unproduced, unmade, and unconditioned.

segment_text: If there were no unborn, unproduced, unmade, and unconditioned, then you would find no escape here from the born, produced, made, and conditioned.

segment_text: But since there is an unborn, unproduced, unmade, and unconditioned, an escape is found from the born, produced, made, and conditioned.”

title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: “There are, mendicants, these two elements of extinguishment.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: What two?
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: The element of extinguishment with something left over, and the element of extinguishment with nothing left over.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: And what is the element of extinguishment with something left over?
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: It’s when a mendicant is a perfected one, with defilements ended, who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own true goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: Their five sense faculties still remain. So long as their senses have not gone they continue to experience the agreeable and disagreeable, to feel pleasure and pain.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion in them
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: is called the element of extinguishment with something left over.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: And what is the element of extinguishment with nothing left over?
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: It’s when a mendicant is a perfected one, with defilements ended, who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own true goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: For them, everything that’s felt, being no longer relished, will become cool right here.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: This is called the element of extinguishment with nothing left over.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: These are the two elements of extinguishment.”
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: “These two elements of extinguishment <j>have been explained
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: by the Clear-eyed One, the unattached, the poised.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: One element pertains to the present life—
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: what is left over <j>when the conduit to rebirth has ended.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: What has nothing left over <j>pertains to what follows this life,
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: where all states of existence cease.
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: Those who have fully understood <j>the unconditioned state—
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: their minds freed, the conduit to rebirth ended—
title: Elements of Extinguishment

segment_text: attained to the heart of the Dhamma, <j>they delight in ending,
title: Elements of Extinguishment

title: The Benefits of Training

segment_text: “Mendicants, live with training as benefit, with wisdom as overseer, with freedom as core, and with mindfulness as ruler.
title: The Benefits of Training

segment_text: A mendicant who lives in this way can expect one of two results:

title: Wake Up

segment_text: “A mendicant should meditate wakeful, mendicants, mindful and aware, joyful and clear, and at times discern the skillful qualities in that state.
title: Wake Up

segment_text: A mendicant who meditates in this way can expect one of two results:
title: Wake Up

segment_text: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
title: Wake Up

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Wake Up

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Wake Up

segment_text: “Listen up, wakeful ones!
title: Wake Up

segment_text: And those asleep, wake up!
title: Wake Up

segment_text: Wakefulness is better than sleep,
title: Wake Up

segment_text: the wakeful have nothing to fear.
title: Wake Up

segment_text: Those who are wakeful, mindful and aware,
title: Wake Up

segment_text: immersed in samādhi, joyful and clear,
title: Wake Up

segment_text: rightly investigating the Dhamma in good time,
title: Wake Up

segment_text: at one, would banish the darkness.
title: Wake Up

segment_text: That’s why you should apply yourself to wakefulness.
title: Wake Up

segment_text: A keen and alert mendicant, possessing absorption,
title: Wake Up

segment_text: having cut the fetter of birth and old age,
title: Wake Up

segment_text: would experience supreme awakening in this very life.”
title: Wake Up

segment_text: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
title: Wake Up

title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: “Mendicants, two kinds of people are bound for a place of loss, bound for hell, if they don’t give up this fault.
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: What two?
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: Someone who is unchaste, but claims to be celibate; and someone who makes a groundless accusation of unchastity against a person whose celibacy is pure.
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: These are the two kinds of people bound for a place of loss, bound for hell, if they don’t give up this fault.”
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: “A liar goes to hell,
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: as does one who denies what they did.
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: Both are equal in the hereafter,
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: those men of base deeds.
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: Many who wrap their necks in ocher robes
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: are unrestrained and wicked.
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: Being wicked, they are reborn in hell
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: due to their bad deeds.
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: It’d be better for the immoral and unrestrained
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: to eat an iron ball,
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: scorching, like a burning flame,
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: than to eat the nation’s alms.”
title: Bound for Loss

segment_text: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
title: Bound for Loss

title: Misconceptions

segment_text: “Overcome by two misconceptions, mendicants, some gods and humans get stuck, some overreach, while those with vision see.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: And how do some get stuck?
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: Because of love, delight, and enjoyment of existence, when the Dhamma is being taught for the cessation of existence, the minds of some gods and humans are not eager, confident, settled, and decided.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: That is how some get stuck.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: And how do some overreach?
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: Some, becoming horrified, repelled, and disgusted with existence, delight in ending existence:
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: ‘When this self is annihilated and destroyed when the body breaks up, and doesn’t exist after death:
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: that is peaceful, that is sublime, that is reality.’
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: That is how some overreach.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: And how do those with vision see?
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: It’s when a mendicant sees what has come to be as having come to be.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: Seeing this, they are practicing for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding what has come to be.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: That is how those with vision see.”
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: “Those who see what has come to be <j>as having come to be,
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: transcending what has come to be,
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: are freed in accord with the truth,
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: with the ending of craving for continued existence.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: They completely understand what has come to be,
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: rid of craving for rebirth in this or that state,
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: with the disappearance of what has come to be,
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: a mendicant does not come back to future lives.”
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
title: Misconceptions

segment_text: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: “Mendicants, there are these three feelings.
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: What three?
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: Pleasant, painful, and neutral feeling.
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: Pleasant feeling should be seen as suffering.
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: Painful feeling should be seen as a dart.
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: Neutral feeling should be seen as impermanent.
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: When a mendicant has seen these three feelings in this way,
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: they’re called a noble mendicant who sees rightly, has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: “A mendicant who sees pleasure as pain,
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: and suffering as a dart,
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: and that peaceful, neutral feeling
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: as impermanent
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: sees rightly.
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: And when freed in regards to that,
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: that peaceful sage, with perfect insight,
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: has truly slipped their yokes.”
title: Feelings (2nd)

segment_text: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
title: Feelings (2nd)

title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: “Mendicants, these three people are found in the world.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: What three?
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: One like a rainless cloud, one who rains locally, one who rains all over.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: And how is a person like a rainless cloud?
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: It’s when some person doesn’t give to anyone at all—whether ascetics and brahmins, paupers, vagrants, nomads, or beggars—such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, perfumes, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: That’s how a person is like a rainless cloud.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: And how does a person rain locally?
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: It’s when some person gives to some but not to others—whether ascetics and brahmins, paupers, vagrants, nomads, or beggars—such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, perfumes, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: That’s how a person rains locally.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: And how does a person rain all over?
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: It’s when some person gives to everyone—whether ascetics and brahmins, paupers, vagrants, nomads, or beggars—such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, perfumes, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: That’s how a person rains all over.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: These are the three people found in the world.”
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: “They don’t share the food and drink
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: they have acquired
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: with ascetics or brahmins,
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: with paupers, vagrants, or travelers.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: They’re like a rainless cloud,
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: they say, the meanest of men.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: They don’t give to some,
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: to some they provide.
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: They rain locally,
title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: so say the wise.
title: A Rainless Cloud

title: A Rainless Cloud

segment_text: that person distributes
title: A Rainless Cloud

title: A Rainless Cloud

title: A Rainless Cloud

title: A Rainless Cloud

title: A Rainless Cloud

title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: “Mendicants, an astute person who wishes for three kinds of happiness should take care of their ethics.
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: What three?
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: ‘May I be be praised!’ ‘May I become rich!’ ‘When my body breaks up, after death, may I be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm!’
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: An astute person who wishes for these three kinds of happiness should protect their precepts.”
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Wishing for Happiness

title: Wishing for Happiness

title: Wishing for Happiness

title: Wishing for Happiness

title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: Though you do no wrong,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: if you associate with one who does,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: you’re suspected of wrong,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: and your disrepute grows.
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: Whatever kind of friend you make,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: with whom you associate,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: that’s how you become,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: for so it is when you share your life.
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: The one who associates and the one associated with,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: the one contacted and the one who contacts another,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: are like an arrow smeared with poison
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: that contaminates the quiver.
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: A wise one, fearing contamination,
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: would never have wicked friends.
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: A man who wraps
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: putrid fish in blades of grass
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: makes the grass stink—
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: so it is when associating with fools.
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: But one who wraps
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: sandalwood incense in leaves
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: makes the leaves fragrant—
title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: so it is when associating with the wise.
title: Wishing for Happiness

title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: like the wrapping, the astute
title: Wishing for Happiness

title: Wishing for Happiness

segment_text: and befriend the good.

title: Converging Elements

segment_text: “Mendicants, sentient beings come together and converge because of an element:
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: Those who have bad convictions come together and converge with those who have bad convictions.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: Those who have good convictions come together and converge with those who have good convictions.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: In the past …
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: In the future …
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: At present, too, sentient beings come together and converge because of an element.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: Those who have bad convictions come together and converge with those who have bad convictions.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: Those who have good convictions come together and converge with those who have good convictions.”
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: “Socializing promotes entanglements;
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: they’re cut off by being aloof.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: If you’re lost in the middle of a great sea,
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: and you clamber up on a little log, you’ll sink.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: So too, a person who lives well
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: sinks by relying on a lazy person.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: Hence you should avoid such
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: a lazy person who lacks energy.
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: Dwell with the noble ones
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: who are secluded and determined
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: constantly energetic,
title: Converging Elements

segment_text: the astute who practice absorption.”
title: Converging Elements

title: Decline

title: Decline

title: Decline

segment_text: talk,
title: Decline

title: Decline

segment_text: These three things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
title: Decline

title: Decline

segment_text: What three?
title: Decline

segment_text: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t relish work,
title: Decline

segment_text: talk,
title: Decline

segment_text: and sleep.
title: Decline

segment_text: These three things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”

title: Decline

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Decline

title: Decline

title: Decline

title: Decline

title: Decline

title: Decline

segment_text: being wakeful and stable.
title: Decline

title: Decline

title: Thoughts

segment_text: “Mendicants, there are these three unskillful thoughts.
title: Thoughts

segment_text: What three?
title: Thoughts

segment_text: The thought of being looked up to; of getting material possessions, honor, and popularity; and of fondness for others.
title: Thoughts

segment_text: These are the three unskillful thoughts.”
title: Thoughts

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Thoughts

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Thoughts

segment_text: “One concerned with being looked up to,
title: Thoughts

segment_text: with possessions, honor, and respect,
title: Thoughts

segment_text: with sharing joys with friends,
title: Thoughts

segment_text: is far from the ending of fetters.
title: Thoughts

segment_text: But one who gives up children and herds,
title: Thoughts

segment_text: marriage and acquisitions—
title: Thoughts

segment_text: such a mendicant is capable
title: Thoughts

segment_text: of experiencing the highest awakening.”
title: Thoughts

segment_text: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
title: Thoughts

title: Esteem

segment_text: “I’ve seen, mendicants, sentient beings whose minds are overcome and overwhelmed by honor. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
title: Esteem

segment_text: I’ve seen sentient beings whose minds are overcome and overwhelmed by not being honored. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

segment_text: Now, I don’t say this because I’ve heard it from some other ascetic or brahmin.

title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: “Mendicants, these three cries are uttered among the gods on occasion.
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: What three?
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: When a noble disciple shaves off their hair and beard, dresses in ocher robes, and goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, the gods cry out:
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: ‘This noble disciple intends to join battle with Māra!’
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: This is the first occasion a cry is uttered among the gods.
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: Furthermore, when a noble disciple meditates pursuing the development of the seven qualities that lead to awakening, the gods cry out:
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: ‘This noble disciple is joining battle with Māra!’
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: This is the second occasion a cry is uttered among the gods.
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: Furthermore, when a noble disciple realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, the gods cry out:
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: ‘This noble disciple has won victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle!’
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: This is the third occasion a cry is uttered among the gods.
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: These are the three cries that are uttered among the gods on occasion.”
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: “Seeing the winner of the battle—
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: a disciple of the Buddha,
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: great of heart, rid of naivety—
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: even the deities revere them:
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: ‘Homage to you, O thoroughbred!
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: You won a battle hard to win!
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: Having defeated the army of death,
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: your liberation is unobstructed.’
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: And so the deities revere the one,
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: who has achieved their heart’s desire.
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: For they see nothing in them by means of which
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: they might fall under the sway of Death.”
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
title: The Cry of the Gods

segment_text: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: “Mendicants, when a god is due to pass away from the realm of the gods, five warning signs appear.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: Their flower-garlands wither; their clothes become soiled; they sweat from the armpits; their physical appearance deteriorates; and they no longer delight in their heavenly throne.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: When the other gods know that that god is due to pass away, they wish them well in three ways:
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: ‘Sir, may you go from here to a good place!
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: When you have gone to a good place, may you be blessed with good fortune!
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: When you have been blessed with good fortune, may you become well grounded!’”
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: “Sir, what do the gods reckon to be going to a good place?
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: What do they reckon to be blessed with good fortune?
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: What do they reckon to become well grounded?”
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: “It is human existence, mendicant, that the gods reckon to be going to a good place.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: When a human being gains faith in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: that is what the gods reckon to be blessed with good fortune.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: When that faith in the Realized One is settled, rooted, and planted deep; when it’s strong and can’t be shifted by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: that is what the gods reckon to become well grounded.”
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: The Buddha spoke this matter.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: On this it is said:
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: “When, with the fading of life,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: a god passes from the realm of the gods,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: the gods utter three cries
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: of well-wishing:
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: ‘Sir, go from here to a good place,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: in the company of humans.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: As a human being, gain supreme faith
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: in the true teaching.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: May that faith of yours be settled,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: with roots planted deep,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: unfaltering all life long
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: in the true teaching so well proclaimed.
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: Having given up bad conduct
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: by way of body,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: speech, and mind,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: and whatever else is corrupt;
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: and having done much good,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: by way of body,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: speech, and mind,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: limitless, free of attachments;
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: then, having made much worldly merit
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: by giving gifts,
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: establish other colleagues
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: in the true teaching, the spiritual life.’
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: It is due to such compassion
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: that when the gods know a god
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: is due to pass away, they wish them well:
title: Five Warning Signs

segment_text: ‘Come back, god, again and again!’”

segment_text: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
