title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: goes from this state to another,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: without escaping transmigration.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Knowing this danger,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: the great fear in dependencies,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: independent, free of grasping,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: a mendicant would wander mindful.”
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: “‘Could there be another way?’ …
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: And how could there be?
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: ‘Formless states are more peaceful than states of form’: this is the first contemplation.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: ‘Cessation is more peaceful than formless states’: this is the second contemplation.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: When a mendicant meditates in this way they can expect enlightenment or non-return.”
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Then the Teacher went on to say:
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: “There are beings in the realm of luminous form,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: and others stuck in the formless.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Not understanding cessation,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: they return in future lives.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: But the people who completely understand form,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: not stuck in the formless,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: released in cessation—
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: they are conquerors of death.”
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: “‘Could there be another way?’ …
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: And how could there be?
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: ‘What this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—focuses on as true, the noble ones have clearly seen with right wisdom to be actually false’: this is the first contemplation.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: ‘What this world focuses on as false, the noble ones have clearly seen with right wisdom to be actually true’: this is the second contemplation.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: When a mendicant meditates in this way they can expect enlightenment or non-return.”
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Then the Teacher went on to say:
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: “See how the world with its gods
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: imagines not-self to be self;
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: habituated to name and form,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: imagining this is truth.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: For whatever you imagine it is,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: it turns out to be something else.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: And that is what is false in it,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: for the ephemeral is deceptive by nature.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Extinguishment has an undeceptive nature,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: the noble ones know it as truth.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Having comprehended the truth,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: they are hungerless, extinguished.”
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: “Suppose, mendicants, they questioned you thus: ‘Could there be another way to contemplate the pairs?’
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: You should say, ‘There could.’
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: And how could there be?
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: ‘What this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—focuses on as happiness, the noble ones have clearly seen with right wisdom to be actually suffering’: this is the first contemplation.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: ‘What this world focuses on as suffering, the noble ones have clearly seen with right wisdom to be actually happiness’: this is the second contemplation.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: When a mendicant meditates rightly contemplating a pair of teachings in this way—diligent, keen, and resolute—they can expect one of two results:
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: That is what the Buddha said.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: “Sights, sounds, tastes, smells,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: touches, and thoughts, the lot of them—
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: they’re likable, desirable, and pleasurable
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: as long as you can say that they exist.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: For all the world with its gods,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: this is what they deem happiness.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: And where they cease
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: is deemed as suffering for them.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: The noble ones have seen as happiness
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: the ceasing of identity.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: This insight by those who see
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: contradicts the whole world.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: What others say is happiness
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: the noble ones say is suffering.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: What others say is suffering
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: the noble ones know as happiness.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: See, this teaching is hard to understand,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: it confuses the ignorant.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: There is darkness for the shrouded;
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: blackness for those who don’t see.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: But the good are open;
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: like light for those who see.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Though close, they do not understand,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: those fools inexpert in the teaching.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: They’re mired in desire to be reborn,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: flowing along the stream of lives,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: mired in Māra’s sway:
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: this teaching isn’t easy for them to understand.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Who, apart from the noble ones,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: is qualified to understand this state?
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Having rightly understood this state,
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: the undefiled become fully extinguished.”
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: That is what the Buddha said.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: And while this discourse was being spoken, the minds of sixty mendicants were freed from defilements by not grasping.
title: 3.12 Contemplating Pairs

segment_text: If a mortal desires sensual pleasure
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: and their desire succeeds,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: they definitely become elated,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: having got what they want.
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: But for that person in the throes of pleasure,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: aroused by desire,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: if those pleasures fade,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: it hurts like an arrow’s strike.
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: One who, being mindful,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: avoids sensual pleasures
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: like side-stepping a snake’s head,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: transcends attachment to the world.
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: There are many objects of sensual desire:
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: fields, lands, and gold; cattle and horses;
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: slaves and servants; women and relatives.
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: When a man lusts over these,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: the weak overpower him
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: and adversities crush him.
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: Suffering follows him
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: like water in a leaky boat.
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: That’s why a person, ever mindful,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: should avoid sensual pleasures.
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: Give them up and cross the flood,
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: as a bailed-out boat reaches the far shore.
title: Sensual Pleasures

segment_text: Trapped in a cave, thickly overspread,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: sunk in delusion they stay.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: A person like this is far from seclusion,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: for sensual pleasures in the world <j>are not easy to give up.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: The chains of desire, the bonds of life’s pleasures
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: are hard to escape, for one cannot free another.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: Looking to the past or the future,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: they pray for these pleasures or former ones.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: Greedy, fixated, infatuated by sensual pleasures,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: they are incorrigible, habitually immoral.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: When led to suffering they lament,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: “What will become of us <j>when we pass away from here?”
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: That’s why a person should train in this life:
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: should you know that anything in the world is wrong,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: don’t act wrongly on account of that;
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: for the wise say this life is short.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: I see the world’s population floundering,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: given to craving for future lives.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: Base men wail in the jaws of death,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: not rid of craving for life after life.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: See them flounder over belongings,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: like fish in puddles of a dried-up stream.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: Seeing this, live unselfishly,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: forming no attachment to future lives.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: Rid of desire for both ends,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: having completely understood contact, free of greed,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: doing nothing for which they’d blame themselves,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: the wise don’t cling to the seen and the heard.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: Having completely understood perception <j>and having crossed the flood,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: the sage, not clinging to possessions,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: with dart plucked out, living diligently,
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: does not long for this world or the next.
title: Eight on the Cave

segment_text: Some speak with malicious intent,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: while others speak set on truth.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: When disputes come up a sage does not get involved,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: which is why they’ve no barrenness at all.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: How can you transcend your own view
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: when you’re led by preference, dogmatic in belief?
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: Inventing your own undertakings,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: you’d speak according to your notion.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: Some, unasked, tell others
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: of their own precepts and vows.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: They have an ignoble nature, say the experts,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: since they speak on themselves of their own accord.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: A mendicant, peaceful, quenched,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: never boasts “thus am I” of their precepts.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: They have a noble nature, say the experts,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: not proud of anything in the world.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: For one who formulates and creates teachings,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: and promotes them despite their defects,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: if they see an advantage for themselves,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: they become dependent on that, <j>relying on unstable peace.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: It’s not easy to get over dogmatic views
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: adopted after judging among the teachings.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: That’s why, among all these dogmas, a person
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: rejects one teaching and takes up another.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: The cleansed one has no formulated view
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: at all in the world about the different realms.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: Having given up illusion and conceit,
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: by what path would they go? They are not involved.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: For one who is involved gets embroiled <j>in disputes about teachings—
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: but how to dispute with the uninvolved? <j>About what?
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: For picking up and putting down <j>is not what they do;
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: they have shaken off all views in this very life.
title: Eight on Malice

segment_text: “I see a pure being of ultimate wellness;
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: it is vision that grants a person purity.”
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: Recalling this notion of the ultimate,
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: they believe in the notion <j>that there is one who observes purity.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: If a person were granted purity through what is seen,
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: or if by a notion they could give up suffering,
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: then one with attachments is purified by another:
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: their view betrays them as one who asserts thus.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: The brahmin speaks not of purity from another
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: in terms of what is seen, heard, or thought; <j>or by precepts or vows.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: They are unsullied in the midst of good and evil,
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: letting go what was picked up, <j>without creating anything new here.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: Having let go the last they lay hold of the next;
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: following impulse, they don’t get past the snare.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: They grab on and let go like a monkey
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: grabbing and releasing a branch.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: Having undertaken their own vows, a person
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: visits various teachers, <j>being attached to perception.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: One who knows, having comprehended the truth <j>through the knowledges,
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: does not visit various teachers, being of vast wisdom.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: They are remote from all things
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: seen, heard, or thought.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: Seeing them living openly,
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: how could anyone in this world judge them?
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: They don’t make things up or promote them,
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: or speak of the uttermost purity.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: After untying the tight knot of grasping
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: they long for nothing in the world.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: The brahmin has stepped over the boundary;
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: knowing and seeing, they adopt nothing.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: Neither in love with passion <j>nor besotted by dispassion,
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: there is nothing here they adopt as the ultimate.
title: Eight on the Pure

segment_text: If, maintaining that theirs is the “ultimate” view,
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: a person makes it out to be highest in the world;
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: then they declare all others are “lesser”;
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: that’s why they’re not over disputes.
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: If they see an advantage for themselves
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: in what’s seen, heard, or thought; <j>or in precepts or vows,
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: in that case, having adopted that one alone,
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: they see all others as inferior.
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: Experts say that, too, is a knot,
title: Eight on the Ultimate

segment_text: relying on which people see others as lesser.
title: Eight on the Ultimate

title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: “Some astute folk do say that this <j>is the highest extent
title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: of purification of the spirit.
title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: But some of them, claiming to be experts,
title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: speak of a time when nothing remains.
title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: Knowing that these states are dependent,
title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: and knowing what they depend on, <j>the inquiring sage,
title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: having understood, is freed, and enters no dispute.
title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: The wise do not proceed to life after life.”
title: Quarrels and Disputes

segment_text: “Each maintaining their own view,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: the experts disagree, arguing:
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: ‘Whoever sees it this way <j>understands the teaching;
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: those who reject this are inadequate.’
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: So arguing, they quarrel,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: saying, ‘The other is a fool, an amateur!’
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: Which one of these speaks true,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: for they all claim to be an expert?”
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: “If not accepting another’s teaching
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: makes you a useless fool lacking wisdom,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: then they’re all fools lacking wisdom,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: for they all maintain their own view.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: But if having your own view makes you pristine—
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: pure in wisdom, expert and intelligent—
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: then none of them lack wisdom,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: for such is the view they have all embraced.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: I do not say that it is correct
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: when they call each other fools.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: Each has built up their own view to be the truth,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: which is why they take the other as a fool.”
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: “What some say is true and correct,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: others say is hollow and false.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: So arguing, they quarrel;
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: why don’t ascetics say the same thing?”
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: “The truth is one, there is no second,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: understanding which folk would not argue.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: But those ascetics each boast of different truths;
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: that’s why they don’t say the same thing.”
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: “But why do they speak of different truths,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: these proponents who claim to be experts?
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: Are there really so many different truths,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: or do they just follow their own lines of reasoning?”
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: “No, there are not many different truths
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: that, apart from perception, <j>are lasting in the world.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: Having formed their reasoning <j>regarding different views,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: they say there are two things: true and false.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: The seen, heard, or thought, <j>or precepts or vows—
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: based on these they show disdain.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: Standing in judgment, they scoff,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: saying, ‘The other is a fool, an amateur!’
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: They take the other as a fool on the same grounds
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: that they speak of themselves as an expert.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: Claiming to be an expert on their own authority,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: they disdain the other while saying the same thing.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: They are perfect, <j>according to their own extreme view;
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: drunk on conceit, imagining themselves proficient.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: They have anointed themselves in their own mind,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: for such is the view they have embraced.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: If the word of your opponent makes you deficient,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: then they too are lacking wisdom.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: But if on your own authority <j>you’re a knowledge master, a wise person,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: then there are no fools among the ascetics.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: ‘Those who proclaim a teaching other than this
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: have fallen short of purity, and are inadequate’:
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: so say each one of the sectarians,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: for they are deeply attached to their own view.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: ‘Here alone is purity,’ they say,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: denying that there is purification in other teachings.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: Thus each one of the sectarians, being dogmatic,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: speaks forcefully within the context <j>of their own journey.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: But in that case, so long as they are speaking forcefully <j>of their own journey,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: how can they take the other as a fool?
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: They are the ones who provoke conflict
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: when they call the other a fool <j>with an impure teaching.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: Standing in judgment, <j>measuring by their own standard,
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: they keep getting into disputes with the world.
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: But a person who has given up all judgments
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: creates no conflict in the world.”
title: The Shorter Discourse on Arrayed For Battle

segment_text: “Regarding those who maintain their own view,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: arguing that, ‘This is the only truth’:
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: are all of them subject only to criticism,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: or do some also win praise for that?”
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: “That is a small thing, insufficient for peace,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: these two fruits of conflict, I say.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Seeing this, one ought not get into arguments,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: looking for sanctuary in the land of no conflict.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: One who knows does not get involved
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: with any of the many different convictions.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Why would the uninvolved get involved,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: since they do not believe <j>based on the seen or the heard?
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Those who champion ethics <j>speak of purity through self-control;
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: having undertaken a vow, they stick to it:
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: ‘Let us train right here, then we will be pure.’
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Claiming to be experts, they are led on to future lives.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: If they fall away from their precepts and vows,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: they tremble, having failed in their task.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: They pray and long for purity,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: like one who has lost their caravan <j>while journeying far from home.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: But having given up all precepts and vows,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: and these deeds blameworthy or blameless;
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: not longing for ‘purity’ or ‘impurity’,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: live detached, fostering peace.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Relying on mortification in disgust at sin,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: or else on what is seen, heard, or thought,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: they moan that purification <j>comes through heading upstream,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: not rid of craving for life after life.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: For one who longs there are prayers,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: and trembling too over ideas they have formed.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: But one here for whom there is no passing away <j>or reappearing:
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: why would they tremble? For what would they pray?”
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: “The very same teaching that some say is ‘ultimate’,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: others say is inferior.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Which of these doctrines is true,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: for they all claim to be an expert?”
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: “They say their own teaching is perfect,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: while the teaching of others is inferior.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: So arguing, they quarrel,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: each saying their own convictions are the truth.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: If someone else’s disparagement makes you inferior,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: no-one in any teaching would be distinguished.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: For each of them says the other’s teaching is lacking,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: while forcefully advocating their own.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: But if they honor their own teachings
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: just as they praise their own journeys,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: then all doctrines would be equally valid,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: and purity for them would be an individual matter.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: After judging among the teachings, <j>a brahmin has adopted nothing
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: that requires interpretation by another.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: That’s why they’ve gotten over disputes,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: for they see no other doctrine as best.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Saying, ‘I know, I see, that’s how it is’,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: some believe that purity comes from view.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: But if they’ve really seen, <j>what use is that view to them?
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Overlooking what matters, <j>they say purity comes from another.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: When a person sees, they see name and form,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: and having seen, they will know just these things.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Gladly let them see much or little,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: for experts say this is no way to purity.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: It’s not easy to educate someone who is dogmatic,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: promoting a view they have formulated.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Speaking of the beauty <j>in that on which they depend,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: they talk of purity in accord with what they saw there.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: The brahmin does not get involved <j>with formulating and calculating;
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: they’re not followers of views, <j>nor kinsmen of notions.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Having understood the many different convictions,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: they look on when others grasp.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Having untied the knots here in the world,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: the sage takes no side among factions.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Peaceful among the peaceless, equanimous,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: they don’t grasp when others grasp.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: Having given up former defilements <j>and not making new ones,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: not swayed by preference, <j>nor a proponent of dogma,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: that wise one is released from views,
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: not clinging to the world, <j>nor reproaching themselves.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: They are remote from all things
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: seen, heard, or thought.
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: With burden put down, the sage is released:
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: not formulating, not abstaining, not longing.”
title: The Longer Discourse on Arrayed for Battle

segment_text: “Great seer, I ask you, the kinsman of the Sun,
title: Speedy

segment_text: about seclusion and the state of peace.
title: Speedy

segment_text: How, having seen, is a mendicant quenched,
title: Speedy

segment_text: not grasping anything in this world?”
title: Speedy

segment_text: “They would cut off the idea, ‘I am the thinker,”
title: Speedy

segment_text: said the Buddha,
title: Speedy

segment_text: “which is the root of all concepts of identity <j>due to proliferation.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Ever mindful, they would train to remove
title: Speedy

segment_text: any internal cravings.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Regardless of what things they know,
title: Speedy

segment_text: whether internal or external,
title: Speedy

segment_text: they wouldn’t be proud because of that,
title: Speedy

segment_text: for that is not extinguishment, say the good.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They wouldn’t let that make them conceited,
title: Speedy

segment_text: thinking themselves better or worse or alike.
title: Speedy

segment_text: When questioned in many ways,
title: Speedy

segment_text: they wouldn’t keep justifying themselves.
title: Speedy

segment_text: A mendicant would find peace inside themselves,
title: Speedy

segment_text: and not seek peace from another.
title: Speedy

segment_text: For one at peace inside themselves,
title: Speedy

segment_text: there’s no picking up, whence putting down?
title: Speedy

segment_text: Just as, in the mid-ocean deeps
title: Speedy

segment_text: no waves arise, it stays still;
title: Speedy

segment_text: so too one unstirred is still—
title: Speedy

segment_text: a mendicant would not swell with pride at all.”
title: Speedy

segment_text: “He whose eyes are open has explained
title: Speedy

segment_text: the truth he witnessed, <j>where adversities are removed.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Please now speak of the practice, sir,
title: Speedy

segment_text: the monastic code and immersion in samādhi.”
title: Speedy

segment_text: “With eyes not wanton,
title: Speedy

segment_text: they’d turn their ears from village gossip.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They wouldn’t be greedy for flavors,
title: Speedy

segment_text: nor possessive about anything in the world.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Though struck by contacts,
title: Speedy

segment_text: a mendicant would not lament at all.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They wouldn’t pray for another life,
title: Speedy

segment_text: nor tremble in the face of dangers.
title: Speedy

segment_text: When they receive food and drink,
title: Speedy

segment_text: edibles and clothes,
title: Speedy

segment_text: they wouldn’t store them up,
title: Speedy

segment_text: nor worry about not getting them.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Meditative, not footloose,
title: Speedy

segment_text: they’d avoid remorse and not be negligent.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Then a mendicant would stay
title: Speedy

segment_text: in quiet places to sit and rest.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They wouldn’t take much sleep,
title: Speedy

segment_text: but, being keen, <j>would apply themselves to wakefulness.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They’d give up sloth, illusion, mirth, and play,
title: Speedy

segment_text: and sex and ornamentation.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They wouldn’t cast Artharvaṇa spells, <j>interpret dreams
title: Speedy

segment_text: or omens, or practice astrology.
title: Speedy

segment_text: My followers would not study ominous animal cries,
title: Speedy

segment_text: work as a doctor, or treat an impacted fetus.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Not shaken by criticism,
title: Speedy

segment_text: a mendicant would not pride themselves <j>when praised.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They’d reject greed and stinginess,
title: Speedy

segment_text: anger, and slander.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They’d not stand for buying and selling;
title: Speedy

segment_text: a mendicant would not speak ill at all.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They wouldn’t linger in the village,
title: Speedy

segment_text: nor cajole people from desire for profit.
title: Speedy

segment_text: A mendicant would be no boaster,
title: Speedy

segment_text: nor would they speak suggestively.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They wouldn’t train in impudence,
title: Speedy

segment_text: nor speak argumentatively.
title: Speedy

segment_text: They wouldn’t be led into lying,
title: Speedy

segment_text: nor be deliberately devious.
title: Speedy

segment_text: And they’d never look down on another
title: Speedy

segment_text: because of livelihood, wisdom, or precepts and vows.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Though provoked from hearing much talk
title: Speedy

segment_text: from ascetics saying all different things,
title: Speedy

segment_text: they wouldn’t react harshly,
title: Speedy

segment_text: for the virtuous do not retaliate.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Having understood this teaching,
title: Speedy

segment_text: inquiring, a mendicant would always train mindfully.
title: Speedy

segment_text: Knowing extinguishment as peace,
title: Speedy

segment_text: they’d not be negligent in Gotama’s bidding.
title: Speedy

segment_text: For he is the the vanquisher, the unvanquished,
title: Speedy

segment_text: seer of the truth as witness, not by hearsay—
title: Speedy

segment_text: that’s why, being diligent, they would always train
title: Speedy

segment_text: respectfully in the Buddha’s teaching.”
title: Speedy

segment_text: Peril stems from those who take up arms—
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: just look at people in conflict!
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: I shall extol how I came to be
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: stirred with a sense of urgency.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: I saw this population flounder,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: like a fish in a little puddle.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Seeing them fight each other,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: fear came upon me.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: The world around was hollow,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: all directions were in turmoil.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Wanting a home for myself,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: I saw nowhere unsettled.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Yet even in their settlement they fight—
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: seeing that, I grew uneasy.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Then I saw a dart there,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: so hard to see, stuck in the heart.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: When struck by that dart,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: you run around in all directions.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: But when that same dart has been plucked out,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: you neither run around nor sink down.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: (On that topic, the trainings are recited.)
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Whatever attachments there are in the world,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: don’t pursue them.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Having pierced through sensual pleasures <j>in every way,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: train yourself for quenching.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Be truthful, not rude,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: free of deceit, and rid of slander;
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: without anger, a sage would cross over
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: the evils of greed and avarice.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Prevail over sleepiness, sloth, and drowsiness,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: don’t abide in negligence,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: A person intent on quenching
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: would not stand for arrogance.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Don’t be led into lying,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: or get caught up in fondness for form.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Completely understand conceit,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: and desist from hasty conduct.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Don’t relish the old,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: or welcome the new.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Don’t grieve for what is running out,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: or get attached to things that pull you in.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Greed, I say, is the great flood,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: and longing is the current—
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: the basis, the compulsion,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: the swamp of sensuality so hard to get past.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: The sage never strays from the truth;
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: the brahman stands firm on the shore.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Having given up everything,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: they are said to be at peace.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: They have truly known, they’re a knowledge master,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: understanding the teaching, they are independent.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: They rightly proceed in the world,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: not coveting anything here.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: One who has crossed over sensuality here,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: the snare in the world so hard to get past,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: grieves not, nor hopes;
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: they’ve cut the strings, they’re no longer bound.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: What came before, let wither away,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: and after, let there be nothing.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: If you don’t grasp at the middle,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: you will live at peace.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: One who has no sense of ownership
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: in the whole realm of name and form,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: does not grieve for that which is not,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: they suffer no loss in the world.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: If you don’t think of anything
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: as belonging to yourself or others,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: not finding anything to be ‘mine’,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: you won’t grieve, thinking ‘I don’t have it’.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Not bitter, not fawning,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: unstirred, everywhere even;
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: when asked about one who is unshakable,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: I declare that that is the benefit.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: For the unstirred who understand,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: there’s no performance of deeds.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Desisting from instigation,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: they see sanctuary everywhere.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: A sage doesn’t speak of themselves as being
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: among superiors, inferiors, or equals.
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: Peaceful, rid of stinginess,
title: Taking Up Arms

segment_text: they would overcome.

title: With Sāriputta

segment_text: I shall answer you, Ajita.
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: Where name and form
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: cease with nothing left over—
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: with the cessation of consciousness,
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: that’s where they cease.”
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: “There are those who have assessed the teaching,
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: and many kinds of trainees here.
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: Tell me about their behavior, good sir,
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: when asked, for you are alert.”
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: “Not greedy for sensual pleasures,
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: their mind would be unclouded.
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: Skilled in all things,
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: a mendicant would wander mindful.”
title: The Questions of Ajita

segment_text: “Who here in the world is content?”
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: said Venerable Tissametteyya.
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: “Who has no disturbances?
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: What thoughtful one, having known both ends,
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: is not stuck in the middle?
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: Who do they say is a great man?
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: Who here has escaped the seamstress?”
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: “Leading the spiritual life among sensual pleasures,”
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: “rid of craving, ever mindful;
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: a mendicant who, after assessing, is quenched:
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: that’s who has no disturbances.
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: That thoughtful one, having known both ends,
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: is not stuck in the middle.
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: He is a great man, I declare,
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: he has escaped the seamstress here.”
title: The Questions of Tissametteyya

segment_text: “To the imperturbable, the seer of the root,”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: said Venerable Puṇṇaka,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “I have come seeking with a question.
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: On what grounds have seers and men,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: aristocrats and brahmins here in the world
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: performed so many different <j>sacrifices to the gods?
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: I ask you, Blessed One; please tell me this.”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “Whatever seers and men,”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “aristocrats and brahmins here in the world
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: have performed so many different <j>sacrifices to the gods:
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: all performed sacrifices bound to old age,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: hoping for some state of existence.”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “As to those seers and men,”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: said Venerable Puṇṇaka,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “and aristocrats and brahmins here in the world
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: who have performed so many different <j>sacrifices to the gods:
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: being diligent in the methods of sacrifice,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: have they crossed over rebirth and old age, good sir?
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: I ask you, Blessed One; please tell me this.”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “Hoping, invoking, praying, and worshiping,”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “they pray for pleasure derived from profit.
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: Devoted to sacrifice, besotted by rebirth,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: they’ve not crossed over rebirth and old age, <j>I declare.”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “If those devoted to sacrifice,”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: said Venerable Puṇṇaka,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “have not, by sacrificing, <j>crossed over rebirth and old age,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: then who exactly in the world of gods and humans
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: has crossed over rebirth and old age, good sir?
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: I ask you, Blessed One; please tell me this.”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “Having assessed the world high and low,”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “there is nothing in the world that disturbs them.
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: Peaceful, unclouded, untroubled, <j>with no need for hope—
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: they’ve crossed over rebirth and old age, I declare.”
title: The Questions of Puṇṇaka

segment_text: “I ask you, Blessed One; please tell me this,”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: said Venerable Mettagū,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “for I think you are a knowledge master, evolved.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: Where do all these sufferings come from,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: in all their countless forms in the world?”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “You have rightly asked me of the origin of suffering,”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “I shall tell you as I understand it.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: Attachment is the source of suffering
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: in all its countless forms in the world.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: When an ignorant person builds up attachments,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: that idiot returns to suffering again and again.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: So let one who understands <j>not build up attachments,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: contemplating the origin of suffering and rebirth.”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “Whatever I asked you have explained to me.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: I ask you once more, please tell me this:
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: How do the wise cross the flood
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: of rebirth, old age, sorrow, and lamenting?
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: Please, sage, answer me clearly,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: for truly you understand this matter.”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “I shall extol a teaching to you,”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “that is apparent in the present, <j>not relying on tradition.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: Having understood it, one who lives mindfully
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: may cross over clinging in the world.”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “And I rejoice, great seer,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: in that supreme teaching,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: having understood which, one who lives mindfully
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: may cross over clinging in the world.”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “Once you’ve expelled relishing and dogmatism,”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “regarding everything you are aware of—
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: above, below, all round, between—
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: having uprooted consciousness, <j>don’t continue in existence.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: A mendicant who wanders meditating like this,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: diligent and mindful, calling nothing their own,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: would, being wise, give up the suffering
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: of rebirth, old age, sorrow and lamenting right here.”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “I rejoice in the words of the great seer!
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: You have expounded non-attachment well, Gotama.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: Clearly the Buddha has given up suffering,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: for truly you understand this matter.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: Surely those you’d regularly instruct
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: would also give up suffering.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: Therefore, having met, I bow to you, <j>O spiritual giant;
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: hopefully the Buddha may regularly instruct me.”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “Any brahmin recognized as a knowledge master,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: who has nothing, unattached to sensual life,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: clearly has crossed this flood,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: crossed to the far shore, kind, wishless.
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: And a wise person here, a knowledge master,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: having untied the bond to life after life,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: free of craving, untroubled, with no need for hope,
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: has crossed over rebirth and old age, I declare.”
title: The Questions of Mettagū

segment_text: “I ask you, Blessed One; please tell me this,”

title: The Questions of Dhotaka

title: The Questions of Dhotaka

title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: a brahmin travelling with nothing.

segment_text: Therefore I bow to you, All-seer:
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: “I am not able to release anyone
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: in the world who has doubts, Dhotaka.

title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: you shall cross this flood.”

title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: the principle of seclusion so that I may understand.
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: I wish to practice right here, peaceful, independent,
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: as unimpeded as space.”
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: “I shall extol that peace for you,”
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: “that is apparent in the present, <j>not relying on tradition.
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: Having understood it, one who lives mindfully
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: may cross over clinging in the world.”
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: “And I rejoice, great seer,
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: in that supreme peace,
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: having understood which, one who lives mindfully
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: may cross over clinging in the world.”
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: “Once you have understood that everything,”
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: “you are aware of in the world—
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: above, below, all round, between—
title: The Questions of Dhotaka

segment_text: “Alone and independent, O Sakyan,”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: said Venerable Upasīva,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “I am not able to cross the great flood.
title: The Questions of Upasīva

title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: depending on which I may cross this flood.”

title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: depending on the perception ‘there is nothing’, <j>cross the flood.
title: The Questions of Upasīva

title: The Questions of Upasīva

title: The Questions of Upasīva

title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: said Venerable Upasīva,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “depending on nothingness, all else left behind,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: intent on the ultimate liberation of perception:
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: might they remain there without travelling on?”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “One free of all sensual desires,”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “depending on nothingness, all else left behind,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: intent on the ultimate liberation of perception:
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: they might remain there without travelling on.”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “If they were to remain there without travelling on,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: even for myriad years, All-seer,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: and, being freed, were to grow cool right there,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: would the consciousness of such a one pass away?”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: replied the Buddha,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “comes to an end beyond reckoning;
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: so too, a sage freed from mental phenomena
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: comes to an end beyond reckoning.”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “One who has come to an end—do they not exist?
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: Or do they exist in a state of eternal wellness?
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: Please, sage, answer me clearly,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: for truly you understand this matter.”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “One who has come to an end cannot be defined,”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: replied the Buddha.
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “They have nothing <j>by which one might describe them.
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: When all things have been eradicated,
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: eradicated, too, are all ways of speech.”
title: The Questions of Upasīva

segment_text: “Those who have previously answered me,”

segment_text: said Venerable Hemaka,
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: “before I encountered Gotama’s teaching,
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: said ‘thus it was’ or ‘so it shall be’.
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: All that was just the testament of hearsay;
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: all that just fostered speculation:
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: I found no delight in that.
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: But you, sage, explain to me
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: the teaching that destroys craving.
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: Having understood it, one who lives mindfully
title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: may cross over clinging in the world.”
title: The Questions of Hemaka

title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: for what is seen, heard, thought, or cognized here;

segment_text: is extinguishment, the imperishable state.
title: The Questions of Hemaka

title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: are extinguished in this very life.

title: The Questions of Hemaka

segment_text: they’ve crossed over clinging to the world.”

segment_text: replied the Buddha,

segment_text: “and for whom there is no craving,

segment_text: diseased, obsessed over,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: in which nothing lasts at all.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: See this fancy figure,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: with its gems and earrings;
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: it is bones encased in skin,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: made pretty by its clothes.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Rouged feet
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: and powdered face
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: may be enough to beguile a fool,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: but not a seeker of the far shore.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Hair in eight braids
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: and eyeshadow
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: may be enough to beguile a fool,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: but not a seeker of the far shore.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: A rotting body all adorned
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: like a freshly painted makeup box
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: may be enough to beguile a fool,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: but not a seeker of the far shore.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: The hunter laid his snare,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: but the deer didn’t spring the trap.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I’ve eaten the bait and now I go,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: leaving the trapper to lament.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: The hunter’s snare is broken,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: but the deer didn’t spring the trap.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I’ve eaten the bait and now I go,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: leaving the deer-hunter to grieve.”
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: “I see rich people in the world who,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: because of delusion, <j>give not the wealth they’ve earned.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Greedily, they hoard their riches,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: yearning for ever more sensual pleasures.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: A king who conquered the earth by force,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: ruling the land from sea to sea,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: unsatisfied with the near shore of the ocean,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: would still yearn for the further shore.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Not just the king, but others too,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: reach death not rid of craving.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: They leave the body still wanting,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: for in this world sensual pleasures never satisfy.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Relatives lament, their hair disheveled,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: saying ‘Ah! Alas! They’re not immortal!’
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: They take out the body wrapped in a shroud,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: heap up a pyre, and burn it there.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: It’s poked with stakes while being burnt,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: in just a single cloth, all wealth gone.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Relatives, friends, and companions
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: can’t help you when you’re dying.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Heirs take your riches,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: while beings fare on according to their deeds.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Riches don’t follow you when you die;
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: nor do children, wife, wealth, nor kingdom.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Longevity isn’t gained by riches,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: nor does wealth banish old age;
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: for the wise say this life is short,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: it’s perishable and not eternal.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: The rich and the poor feel its touch;
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: the fool and the wise feel it too.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: But the fool lies stricken by their own folly,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: while the wise don’t tremble at the touch.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Therefore wisdom’s much better than wealth,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: since by wisdom <j>you reach consummation in this life.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: But if because of delusion <j>you don’t reach consummation,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: you’ll do evil deeds in life after life.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: One who enters a womb and the world beyond,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: will transmigrate from one life to the next.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: While someone of little wisdom, <j>placing faith in them,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: also enters a womb and the world beyond.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: As a bandit caught in the door
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: is punished for his own bad deeds;
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: so after departing, in the world beyond,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: people are punished for their own bad deeds.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Sensual pleasures are diverse, sweet, delightful,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: appearing in disguise they disturb the mind.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Seeing danger in sensual stimulations,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I went forth, O King.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: As fruit falls from a tree, so people fall,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: young and old, when the body breaks up.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Seeing this, too, I went forth, O King;
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: the ascetic life is guaranteed to be better.”
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: “I went forth out of faith
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: joining the victor’s dispensation.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: My going forth wasn’t wasted;
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I enjoy my food free of debt.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I saw sensual pleasures as burning,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: gold as a cutting blade,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: conception in a womb as suffering,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: and the hells as very fearful.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: Knowing this danger,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I was struck with a sense of urgency.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I was stabbed, but then I found peace,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: attaining the end of defilements.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I’ve served the teacher
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: and fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: The heavy burden is laid down,
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: the conduit to rebirth is eradicated.
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: I’ve reached the goal
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: for the sake of which I went forth
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: from the lay life to homelessness—
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: the ending of all fetters.”
title: Raṭṭhapāla

segment_text: “O Blessed One, your body’s perfect,
title: Sela

segment_text: you’re radiant, handsome, lovely to behold;
title: Sela

segment_text: golden colored,
title: Sela

segment_text: with teeth so white; you’re strong.
title: Sela

segment_text: The characteristics
title: Sela

segment_text: of a handsome man,
title: Sela

segment_text: the marks of a great man,
title: Sela

segment_text: are all found on your body.
title: Sela

segment_text: Your eyes are clear, your face is fair,
title: Sela

segment_text: you’re formidable, upright, majestic.
title: Sela

segment_text: In the midst of the Saṅgha of ascetics,
title: Sela

segment_text: you shine like the sun.
title: Sela

segment_text: You’re a mendicant fine to see,
title: Sela

segment_text: with skin of golden sheen.
title: Sela

segment_text: But with such excellent appearance,
title: Sela

segment_text: what do you want with the ascetic life?
title: Sela

segment_text: You’re fit to be a king,
title: Sela

segment_text: a wheel-turning monarch, chief of charioteers,
title: Sela

segment_text: victorious in the four quarters,
title: Sela

segment_text: lord of all India.
title: Sela

segment_text: Aristocrats, nobles, and kings
title: Sela

segment_text: ought follow your rule.
title: Sela

segment_text: Gotama, you should reign
title: Sela

segment_text: as king of kings, lord of men!”
title: Sela

segment_text: “I am a king, Sela”,
title: Sela

segment_text: said the Buddha to Sela,
title: Sela

segment_text: “the supreme king of the teaching.
title: Sela

segment_text: By the teaching I roll forth the wheel
title: Sela

segment_text: which cannot be rolled back.”
title: Sela

segment_text: “You claim to be awakened,”
title: Sela

segment_text: said Sela the brahmin,
title: Sela

segment_text: “the supreme king of the teaching.
title: Sela

segment_text: ‘I roll forth the teaching’:
title: Sela

segment_text: so you say, Gotama.
title: Sela

segment_text: Then who is your general,
title: Sela

segment_text: the disciple who follows the Teacher’s way?
title: Sela

segment_text: Who keeps rolling the wheel
title: Sela

segment_text: of the teaching you rolled forth?”
title: Sela

segment_text: “By me the wheel was rolled forth,”
title: Sela

segment_text: said the Buddha,
title: Sela

segment_text: “the supreme wheel of the teaching.
title: Sela

segment_text: Sāriputta, taking after the Realized One,
title: Sela

segment_text: keeps it rolling on.
title: Sela

segment_text: I have known what should be known,
title: Sela

segment_text: and developed what should be developed,
title: Sela

segment_text: and given up what should be given up:
title: Sela

segment_text: and so, brahmin, I am a Buddha.
title: Sela

segment_text: Dispel your doubt in me—
title: Sela

segment_text: make up your mind, brahmin!
title: Sela

segment_text: The sight of a Buddha
title: Sela

segment_text: is hard to find again.
title: Sela

segment_text: I am a Buddha, brahmin,
title: Sela

segment_text: the supreme surgeon,
title: Sela

segment_text: one of those whose appearance in the world
title: Sela

segment_text: is hard to find again.
title: Sela

segment_text: A manifestation of divinity, unequaled,
title: Sela

segment_text: crusher of Māra’s army;
title: Sela

segment_text: having subdued all my opponents,
title: Sela

segment_text: I rejoice, fearing nothing from any quarter.”
title: Sela

segment_text: “Pay heed, sirs, to what
title: Sela

segment_text: is spoken by the Clear-eyed One.
title: Sela

segment_text: The surgeon, the great hero,
title: Sela

segment_text: roars like a lion in the jungle.
title: Sela

segment_text: A manifestation of divinity, unequaled,
title: Sela

segment_text: crusher of Māra’s army;
title: Sela

segment_text: who would not be inspired by him,
title: Sela

segment_text: even one whose nature is dark?
title: Sela

segment_text: Those who wish may follow me;
title: Sela

segment_text: those who don’t may go.
title: Sela

segment_text: Right here, I’ll go forth in his presence,
title: Sela

segment_text: the one of such splendid wisdom.”
title: Sela

segment_text: “Sir, if you like
title: Sela

segment_text: the teaching of the Buddha,
title: Sela

segment_text: we’ll also go forth in his presence,
title: Sela

segment_text: the one of such splendid wisdom.”
title: Sela

segment_text: “These three hundred brahmins
title: Sela

segment_text: with joined palms held up, ask:
title: Sela

segment_text: ‘May we lead the spiritual life
title: Sela

segment_text: in your presence, Blessed One?’”
title: Sela

segment_text: “The spiritual life is well explained,”
title: Sela

segment_text: said the Buddha,
title: Sela

segment_text: “apparent in the present life, immediately effective.
title: Sela

segment_text: Here the going forth isn’t in vain
title: Sela

segment_text: for one who trains with diligence.”
title: Sela

segment_text: “This is the eighth day since
title: Sela

segment_text: we went for refuge, O Clear-eyed One.
title: Sela

segment_text: In these seven days, Blessed One,
title: Sela

segment_text: we’ve become tamed in your teaching.
title: Sela

segment_text: You are the Buddha, you are the Teacher,
title: Sela

segment_text: you are the sage who has overcome Māra;
title: Sela

segment_text: “While walking, ascetic, you say ‘I’ve stopped.’

title: Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Aṅgulimāla, I have forever stopped—
title: Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: I’ve laid aside violence towards all creatures.
title: Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But you can’t stop yourself <j>from harming living creatures;
title: Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: that’s why I’ve stopped, but you have not.”
title: Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Oh, at long last a renowned great seer,
title: Aṅgulimāla

title: Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: I shall discard a thousand evils.”

title: Aṅgulimāla

title: Aṅgulimāla

title: Anuruddha
